summary: This is a cover letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell. It confirms the ongoing legal proceedings against Maxwell in 2020.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) to whom discovery materials are being sent by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: She is the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter transmitting discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the prosecution and discovery process in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Transmission to Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) as of October 2020.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively prosecuting Maxwell under case number 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
Audrey Strauss was the Acting United States Attorney overseeing the case at that time.
The document is a formal cover letter for transmitting legal discovery materials to the defendant.
